required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of BCD-063 and Copaxone-Teva in Patients With Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: International, Multicentre, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Comparative, Randomized Study to Compare Efficacy and Safety of the Generic Drug BCD-063 (CJSC "BIOCAD", Russia) and Copaxone®-Teva ("Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Limited", Israel) in Patients With Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the clinical study of the medicinal product for medical use: to compare efficacy and safety of the generic drug BCD-063 and Copaxone®-Teva in patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis.
Period of the clinical study of the medicinal product for medical use: from June 10, 2013 to March 23, 2016.
Number of patients, involved into the study of the medicinal product for medical use: 158 patients.

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative Unique Activity (CUA) detected by MRI

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients without confirming relapses with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing in volume of hypointense T1 lesions
Changing in volume of T2 lesions
Amount of new or extended lesions in T2 regimen

secondary_outcome.description: Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS) scale count at 24th and 48th week, comparing count at week 24 to week 48 for each group

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression on Multiple Sclerosis Functional Composite scale comparing to the baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Relative Risk Ratio for relapse in each group

secondary_outcome.measure: Multiple Sclerosis Functional Composite scale dynamics
secondary_outcome.description: Multiple Sclerosis Functional Composite (MSFC) scale count at 24th and 48th week, comparing count at week 24 to week 48 for each group

arm_group.description: Subcutaneous injection of glatiramer acetate BCD-063 subcutaneously every day
Subcutaneous injection of glatiramer acetate Copaxone-Teva subcutaneously every day
Subcutaneous injection of mannitol 40 mg, water for injections till 1 ml, every day
